name: Nidalee
title: the Bestial Huntress

P.name: Prowl

effects.description: Innate - Prowl: Being in brush grants Nidalee 10% bonus movement speed for 2 seconds, increased to 30% when facing a nearby visible enemy champion.

Innate - Hunt: Hitting nearby monsters or enemy champions with Javelin Toss or Bushwhack marks them as Hunted, revealing them for 4 seconds and granting Nidalee 10% bonus movement speed for the same duration, increased to 30% when facing a nearby Hunted target. Additionally, Nidalee's first use of Takedown and Pounce against Hunted targets are empowered.
The bonus movement speed from Prowl and Hunt can stack, but cannot exceed 30%.

P.blurb: Moving through brush increases Nidalee's Movement Speed by 10% for 2 seconds, increased to 30% toward visible enemy champions within 1400 range. Hitting champions or monsters with Javelin Toss or Bushwhack triggers a Hunt, granting True Sight of them for 4 seconds. During this time, Nidalee gains 10% Movement Speed (increased to 30% toward the Hunted target) and her Takedown and Pounce are enhanced against them.

Q.name: Javelin Toss

effects.description: Active: Nidalee hurls a javelin in a line in the target direction, dealing magic damage to the first enemy it hits, increased based on distance traveled.

Q.notes:
Javelin Toss will fire from wherever Nidalee was at the start of the cast time.
The damage amplification is based on the distance from Nidalee's location at the end of the cast time to the struck target.
 𝐏𝐄𝐍𝐃𝐈𝐍𝐆 𝐅𝐎𝐑 𝐓𝐄𝐒𝐓 : distance to missile termination location or target center?
Q.blurb: In human form, Nidalee throws a spiked javelin at her target that gains damage as it flies.

Q.name: Takedown

effects.description: Active: Nidalee's next basic attack within 10 seconds has an uncancelable windup, gains 75 bonus range and is modified to deal magic damage, increased by an amount for every 1% of target's missing health. The minimum damage can also be applied against turrets.
Hunt Bonus: Takedown deals 40% increased damage to Hunted targets.
Takedown resets Nidalee's basic attack timer. Other damage converted to magic damage by Takedown are not increased by Takedown's respective effects.

Q.notes:
Takedown's attack deals  basic damage, but also triggers spell effects by dealing an additional 0  spell damage.
Increased damage to  Hunted targets is displayed as a  cosmetic critical strike: Unless Nidalee has critical strike chance and the attack rolled a  critical strike naturally, it is unaffected by critical damage modifiers.
 Basic attacks enhanced by Takedown convert Spellblade damage from physical to magic, if it was not already magic. Their damage is however not increased by Takedown.
Takedown's damage will apply  life steal.
 𝐏𝐄𝐍𝐃𝐈𝐍𝐆 𝐅𝐎𝐑 𝐓𝐄𝐒𝐓  - Parry interactions ( dodge,  block and  blind).
Q.blurb: As a cougar, her next attack will attempt to fatally wound her target, dealing more damage the less life they have.

W.name: Bushwhack

effects.description: Active: Nidalee lays a trap at the target location which becomes stealthed after arming over 1.5 seconds, lasting for up to 120 seconds and granting sight within its radius. The trap will spring upon contact with an enemy, dealing them magic damage per second over 4 seconds.

Traps have 6 maximum health and can only be damaged by champion basic attacks (2 hit points from ranged and 3 hit points from melee). Up to a maximum of 4 / 6 / 8 / 10 (based on level) traps may be active at once.

W.blurb: In human form, Nidalee lays a trap for unwary opponents that, when sprung, damages and reveals its target.

W.name: Pounce

effects.description: Active: Nidalee dashes a fixed distance in the target direction, dealing magic damage to nearby enemies upon arrival.

Hunt Bonus: Nidalee can perform Pounce from an increased range on a Hunted enemy closest to the cursor. Nidalee can Pounce to a target location near a Hunted enemy if she is close to the Hunted enemy.
Killing an enemy while in Cougar Form or using Pounce's Hunt bonus reduces Pounce's remaining cooldown to a value. This has no effect if the remaining cooldown is already lower than that value.
Pounce will cast at max range if cast beyond that.

W.notes:
Pounce will not receive the reduced cooldown if the target becomes Hunted mid-air.
Pounce without a Hunted target will have a fixed distance and use direction-targeting.
Pounce in the direction of a Hunted target that is inside of normal ability range will use location-targeting and place Nidalee at the target location.
Pounce on a Hunted target that is out of normal ability range will use unit-targeting and place Nidalee on the side of the target that the target is facing.
W.blurb: As a cougar, she jumps in a direction, dealing damage in an area where she lands.

E.name: Primal Surge

effects.description: Active: Nidalee evokes the spirit of the cougar, healing the target allied champion or herself, increased by 0% − 100% (based on target's missing health), and granting the target bonus attack speed for 7 seconds.

E.notes: The bonus attack speed will persist through  Cougar Form if Nidalee uses Primal Surge on herself.
E.blurb: In human form, Nidalee channels the spirit of the cougar to heal her allies and imbue them with Attack Speed for a short duration.

E.name: Swipe

effects.description: Active: Nidalee slashes her claws in an arc in the target direction, dealing magic damage to all enemies within the area.

E.notes:
Swipe will fire from wherever Nidalee was at the start of the cast time.
The visual effects will be seen from her position if she moves however.*
E.blurb: As a cougar, she claws in a direction, dealing damage to enemies in front of her.

R.name: Aspect of the Cougar

effects.description: Active: Nidalee transforms herself into a cougar, gaining melee attacks with 125 range as well as new abilities.
Active: Nidalee transforms herself into a human, gaining ranged attacks with 525 range as well as new abilities.
Triggering Hunt resets Aspect of the Cougar's cooldown if Nidalee is in human form.
Nidalee begins with one rank in Aspect of the Cougar and can increase it at levels 6, 11, and 16.

R.notes: Transformations do not count as ability activations for the purposes of on-cast effects such as Spellblade and stacking  Force Pulse.
R.blurb: Nidalee transforms into a cougar, gaining new abilities.

lore: Raised in the deepest jungle, Nidalee is a master tracker who can shapeshift into a ferocious cougar at will. Neither wholly woman nor beast, she viciously defends her territory from any and all trespassers, with carefully placed traps and deft spear throws. She cripples her quarry before pouncing on them in feline form—the lucky few who survive tell tales of a wild woman with razor-sharp instincts, and even sharper claws...

skins.name: Original
skins.lore: Raised in the deepest jungle, Nidalee is a master tracker who can shapeshift into a ferocious cougar at will. Neither wholly woman nor beast, she viciously defends her territory from any and all trespassers, with carefully placed traps and deft spear throws. She cripples her quarry before pouncing on them in feline form—the lucky few who survive tell tales of a wild woman with razor-sharp instincts, and even sharper claws…

skins.name: Snow Bunny
skins.lore: A fierce warrior who makes her home in the winter forest, Nidalee isn't content with simple Snowdown parties. She plays the role of Santa for cheery woodland creatures, driving off intruders and protecting her furry friends from harm.

skins.name: Pharaoh
skins.lore: At the height of her power, Nidalee was worshipped as a god-queen of the Great Desert. After her city's fall, she gathered her remaining armies and marched west, to conquer and rule anew.

skins.name: Bewitching
skins.lore: She is a cat. That is a hat. Legally, we're not allowed to put those two thoughts together.

skins.name: Headhunter
skins.lore: It's one thing to be hunted by a human; it's another to be chased down by an animal. Nidalee's alien biology allows her both—a rare gift among the Headhunters.

skins.name: Warring Kingdoms
skins.lore: A wild, untamed fighter steeped in myth, it is difficult to know what is true of Nidalee and what is legend. Some say she fights with the ferocity of a white tiger, while others of the Warring Kingdoms believe she can become the creature itself.

descriptions.description: Loot exclusive gained during the 2019 MSI Event.

skins.name: Super Galaxy
skins.lore: Nidalee shows the most promise of the new class of Super Galaxy cadets, a knack for throwing projectiles through zero-gravity being her signature talent. The team will need her cunning tactics, as well as her keen hunting instincts, if it is to defeat the Spider Queen.

skins.name: Dawnbringer

descriptions.description: This chroma was released as a Loot exclusive in 2019.
This chroma was released as a bundle exclusive in 2019.

skins.lore: Nidalee rules over the restorative calm of the natural world, guarding the land's remaining peaceful places. She fights to protect the land and living things, bringing light and order to the mortal creatures under her care—even taking the form of a celestial beast.

skins.name: Cosmic Huntress

descriptions.description: This chroma was released as a bundle exclusive in 2020.

skins.lore: A cosmic tracker and ferocious warrior, she is tasked to find newborn stars and defend them from the ever-hungry Dark Star corruptants. Darting from galaxy to galaxy in an eternal hunt, she is forever shifting her shape like the wandering stars in the sky.
